verses.verse: Thou shalt not see <S%H7200><s%> thy brother <S%H251><s%>'s ox <S%H7794><s%> or his sheep <S%H7716><s%> go astray <S%H5080><s%>, and hide <S%H5956><s%> thyself from them <S%H7725><s%>: thou shalt surely bring them again <S%H7725><s%> unto thy brother <S%H251><s%>.

And if thy brother <S%H251><s%> be not nigh <S%H7138><s%> unto thee <S%H3045><s%>, or if thou know him not <S%H622><s%>, then thou shalt bring it home to <S%H8432><s%> thy house <S%H1004><s%>, and it shall be with thee until thy brother <S%H251><s%> seek <S%H1875><s%> after it <S%H7725><s%>, and thou shalt restore it to him.

And so <S%H3651><s%> shalt thou do <S%H6213><s%> with his ass <S%H2543><s%>; and so shalt thou do <S%H6213><s%> with his garment <S%H8071><s%>; and so shalt thou do <S%H6213><s%> with every lost thing <S%H9><s%> of thy brother <S%H251><s%>'s, which he hath lost <S%H6><s%>, and thou hast found <S%H4672><s%>: thou mayest <S%H3201><s%> not hide thyself <S%H5956><s%>.

Thou shalt not see <S%H7200><s%> thy brother <S%H251><s%>'s ass <S%H2543><s%> or his ox <S%H7794><s%> fallen down <S%H5307><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%>, and hide <S%H5956><s%> thyself from them <S%H6965><s%>: thou shalt surely help him to lift them up again <S%H6965><s%>.

A woman <S%H802><s%> shall not wear that which pertaineth <S%H3627><s%> unto a man <S%H1397><s%>, neither shall a man <S%H1397><s%> put <S%H3847><s%> on a woman <S%H802><s%>'s garment <S%H8071><s%>; for whosoever doeth <S%H6213><s%> these things <S%H428><s%> is an abomination <S%H8441><s%> unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>.

If a bird <S%H6833><s%>'s nest <S%H7064><s%> chance <S%H7122><s%> to be before <S%H6440><s%> thee in the way <S%H1870><s%>, in any tree <S%H6086><s%> or on the ground <S%H776><s%>, with young ones <S%H667><s%> or eggs <S%H1000><s%>, and the dam <S%H517><s%> sitting <S%H7257><s%> upon the young <S%H667><s%>, or upon the eggs <S%H1000><s%>, thou shalt not take <S%H3947><s%> the dam <S%H517><s%> with the young <S%H1121><s%>:

thou shalt surely <S%H7971><s%> let the dam <S%H517><s%> go <S%H7971><s%>, but the young <S%H1121><s%> thou mayest take <S%H3947><s%> unto thyself <S%H3190><s%>; that it may be well with thee <S%H748><s%>, and that thou mayest prolong thy days <S%H3117><s%>.

When thou buildest <S%H1129><s%> a new <S%H2319><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>, then thou shalt make <S%H6213><s%> a battlement <S%H4624><s%> for thy roof <S%H1406><s%>, that thou bring <S%H7760><s%> not blood <S%H1818><s%> upon thy house <S%H1004><s%>, if any man <S%H5307><s%> fall from thence <S%H5307><s%>.

Thou shalt not sow <S%H2232><s%> thy vineyard <S%H3754><s%> with two kinds of seed <S%H2233><s%>, lest the whole fruit <S%H4395><s%> be forfeited <S%H6942><s%>, the seed <S%H2233><s%> which thou hast sown <S%H2232><s%>, and the increase <S%H8393><s%> of the vineyard <S%H3754><s%>.
Thou shalt not plow <S%H2790><s%> with an ox <S%H7794><s%> and an ass <S%H2543><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>.
Thou shalt not wear <S%H3847><s%> a mingled <S%H8162><s%> stuff <S%H6785><s%>, wool and linen <S%H6593><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>.
Thou shalt make <S%H6213><s%> thee fringes <S%H1434><s%> upon the four <S%H702><s%> borders <S%H3671><s%> of thy vesture <S%H3682><s%>, wherewith thou coverest thyself <S%H3680><s%>.
If any man <S%H376><s%> take <S%H3947><s%> a wife <S%H802><s%>, and go in <S%H935><s%> unto her <S%H8130><s%>, and hate her,

and lay <S%H7760><s%> shameful <S%H5949><s%> things <S%H1697><s%> to her charge <S%H3318><s%>, and bring up an evil <S%H7451><s%> name <S%H8034><s%> upon her <S%H559><s%>, and say, I took <S%H3947><s%> this woman <S%H802><s%>, and when I came <S%H7126><s%> nigh to her <S%H4672><s%>, I found not in her the tokens of virginity <S%H1331><s%>;

then shall the father <S%H1><s%> of the damsel <S%H5291><s%>, and her mother <S%H517><s%>, take <S%H3947><s%> and bring forth <S%H3318><s%> the tokens of the damsel <S%H5291><s%>'s virginity <S%H1331><s%> unto the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%> in the gate <S%H8179><s%>;

and the damsel <S%H5291><s%>'s father <S%H1><s%> shall say <S%H559><s%> unto the elders <S%H2205><s%>, I gave <S%H5414><s%> my daughter <S%H1323><s%> unto this man <S%H376><s%> to wife <S%H802><s%>, and he hateth her <S%H8130><s%>;

and <S%H7760><s%>, lo, he hath laid shameful <S%H5949><s%> things <S%H1697><s%> to her charge <S%H559><s%>, saying, I found <S%H4672><s%> not in thy daughter <S%H1323><s%> the tokens of virginity <S%H1331><s%>; and yet these are the tokens of my daughter <S%H1323><s%>'s virginity <S%H1331><s%>. And they shall spread <S%H6566><s%> the garment <S%H8071><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%>.
And the elders <S%H2205><s%> of that city <S%H5892><s%> shall take <S%H3947><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> and chastise him <S%H3256><s%>;

and they shall fine <S%H6064><s%> him a hundred <S%H3967><s%> shekels of silver <S%H3701><s%>, and give <S%H5414><s%> them unto the father <S%H1><s%> of the damsel <S%H5291><s%>, because he hath brought up <S%H3318><s%> an evil <S%H7451><s%> name <S%H8034><s%> upon a virgin <S%H1330><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>: and she shall be his wife <S%H802><s%>; he may <S%H3201><s%> not put her away <S%H7971><s%> all his days <S%H3117><s%>.
But if this thing <S%H1697><s%> be true <S%H571><s%>, that the tokens of virginity <S%H1331><s%> were not found <S%H4672><s%> in the damsel <S%H5291><s%>;

then they shall bring out <S%H3318><s%> the damsel <S%H5291><s%> to the door <S%H6607><s%> of her father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>, and the men <S%H582><s%> of her city <S%H5892><s%> shall stone <S%H5619><s%> her to death <S%H4191><s%> with stones <S%H68><s%>, because she hath wrought <S%H6213><s%> folly <S%H5039><s%> in Israel <S%H3478><s%>, to play the harlot <S%H2181><s%> in her father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>: so shalt thou put <S%H1197><s%> away <S%H1197><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%> from the midst of thee <S%H7130><s%>.

If a man <S%H376><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> lying <S%H7901><s%> with a woman <S%H802><s%> married <S%H1166><s%> to a husband <S%H1167><s%>, then they shall both of them <S%H8147><s%> die <S%H4191><s%>, the man <S%H376><s%> that lay <S%H7901><s%> with the woman <S%H802><s%>, and the woman <S%H802><s%>: so shalt thou put away <S%H1197><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%> from Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

If there be a damsel <S%H5291><s%> that is a virgin <S%H1330><s%> betrothed <S%H781><s%> unto a husband <S%H376><s%>, and a man <S%H376><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> her in the city <S%H5892><s%>, and lie with her <S%H7901><s%>;

then ye shall bring <S%H3318><s%> them both <S%H8147><s%> out unto the gate <S%H8179><s%> of that city <S%H5892><s%>, and ye shall stone <S%H5619><s%> them to death <S%H4191><s%> with stones <S%H68><s%>; the damsel <S%H5291><s%>, because <S%H834><s%> she cried <S%H6817><s%> not <S%H5892><s%>, being in the city; and the man <S%H376><s%>, because <S%H834><s%> he hath humbled <S%H6031><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s wife <S%H802><s%>: so thou shalt put away <S%H1197><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%> from the midst of thee <S%H7130><s%>.

But if the man <S%H376><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> the damsel <S%H5291><s%> that is betrothed <S%H781><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%>, and the man <S%H376><s%> force <S%H2388><s%> her <S%H7901><s%>, and lie with her <S%H376><s%>; then the man only that lay <S%H7901><s%> with her shall die <S%H4191><s%>:

but unto the damsel <S%H5291><s%> thou shalt do <S%H6213><s%> nothing <S%H1697><s%>; there is in the damsel <S%H5291><s%> no sin <S%H2399><s%> worthy of death <S%H4194><s%>: for as when a man <S%H376><s%> riseth <S%H6965><s%> against his neighbor <S%H7453><s%>, and slayeth <S%H7523><s%> him <S%H1697><s%>, even so is this matter;
for he found <S%H4672><s%> her in the field <S%H7704><s%>, the betrothed <S%H781><s%> damsel <S%H5291><s%> cried <S%H6817><s%>, and there was none to save her <S%H3467><s%>.

If a man <S%H376><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> a damsel <S%H5291><s%> that is a virgin <S%H1330><s%>, that is not betrothed <S%H781><s%>, and lay hold <S%H8610><s%> on her <S%H7901><s%>, and lie with her <S%H4672><s%>, and they be found;

then the man <S%H376><s%> that lay <S%H7901><s%> with her shall give <S%H5414><s%> unto the damsel <S%H5291><s%>'s father <S%H1><s%> fifty <S%H2572><s%> shekels of silver <S%H3701><s%>, and she shall be his wife <S%H802><s%>, because he hath humbled <S%H6031><s%> her <S%H3201><s%>; he may not put her away <S%H7971><s%> all his days <S%H3117><s%>.
A man <S%H376><s%> shall not take <S%H3947><s%> his father <S%H1><s%>'s wife <S%H802><s%>, and shall not uncover <S%H1540><s%> his father <S%H1><s%>'s skirt <S%H3671><s%>.
